sermons.title: (Following The Footsteps Of Christ) The Unique Teacher
Forgiving and Being Forgiven
sermons.description: Debt and guilt are the same before God and it is a great debt that we owe Him due to our guilt before Him.  Thus our forgiveness came at the greatest cost to Him the death of His Son, the Lord Jesus.  And it is not without a cost that we are to forgive others as we have been forgiven, to forgive means to forgoe our rights and to suffer the cost.  Pastor Hession shows that at the root of unforgiveness is pride saying 'I wont forgive this person, they have violated my rights!' and also that when we are wronged and forgive then when the person comes and ask forgiveness we will be able to say 'There is nothing to forgive' as it is an old account that has been settled, just as ours was on Calvary.

sermons.title: The Law Of Forgiveness
sermons.description: Chuck Smith shares on the principle of forgiveness in the Bible. He shares that our personal forgiveness is dependent on our forgiving others.  We all have hurts, oughts, problems in life, God knows this and therefore has given us the way to be free from unforgiveness. He speaks of mercy and the need to err on mercy rather then judgment. He ends the message with the declaration that we cannot forgive apart from God helping us.

sermons.title: The Laws of Prayer
sermons.description: F. J. Heugel expounds about 4 basic 'laws' of prayer, such as the will of God and the law of faith.  By 'law' he means characteristics or 'the realm of spiritual order' that govern prayer.  '[Even] grace has its mold of operation,' he said.  The practical, straight forward teaching from God's Word is wonderfully illustrated by answered prayers from the likes of George Muller, Watchman Nee and others.  (Part 1: The Laws of Prayer / Part 2: The Ministry of Prayer / Part 3: Great Prayers of History)

sermons.title: The Time Has Come to Face the Mountain
sermons.description: September 20, 2009 - Jesus faced the mountain of entrenched rebellion towards the ways of God. It is a systematic religiousness that made His ways unrecognizable to mankind. The wrath of God is truly revealed when He sees man create a system of religion that robs the sinner of the treasure of His heart. The whole desire of God is that His house would be called a house of prayer, and the doors would be open so the outcasts of humanity could come in and find satisfaction to the deepest desires of their heart. God is calling His church to get out of the board rooms and into the prayer closet and cry out to Him to ignite us with the fire of the Holy Ghost and begin to move in His power one more time. Can we believe God to cleanse the temple one more time and awaken His church?

sermons.title: The Triumphal Entry: The King Comes for His Kingdom
WHAT FAITH CAN ACHIEVE
sermons.description: God is building a kingdom for His children out of a very precious material. It is called faith! The following meditation shares what happened when the Sisters from the little Land of Canaan tried to use this material – faith – to build a chapel.

sermons.title: WHAT FAITH CAN ACHIEVE
sermons.description: God is building a kingdom for His children out of a very precious material. It is called faith! This meditation shares what happened when the Sisters from the little Land of Canaan, tried to use this material – faith – to build a chapel.

sermons.title: What Is Faith - Part 2
sermons.description: Faith is not a leap into the dark but a leap into the light. Manley Beasley continues his teaching on faith as a necessary element of the Christian Life. And clears up many wrong teachings on faith. And how to trust Jesus and put your faith in Him for your walk with Him.
